1421.52.text:
I was a puppy running on
people's ankles but I was there.

1425.02.text:
And if you cared about
results on the ground,

1430.73.text:
which was the only thing
I really cared about,

1433.07.text:
what was true ten years later
was that nothing had changed.

1437.87.text:
So there was wonderful
work going on with

1439.94.text:
community policing and 
policing and this and that.

1443.61.text:
And it was it was making
a difference in a lot of

1447.15.text:
ways, it was not making
a difference in these

1449.42.text:
neighborhoods and so
something else had to happen.

1453.02.text:
>>>BOB HERBERT: We're
going to have to stop

1455.02.text:
there, I hope we can bring
you back another time and

1457.36.text:
continue this story
because I'd like to get

1459.36.text:
into more
specifics about your work,

1462.26.text:
it's been wonderful, this half
hour has gone to quickly.

1465.10.text:
It's been wonderful
thanks for coming.

1467.83.text:
We'll be back in a

1487.12.text:
>>>BOB HERBERT: Jerusha Connor,
a professor at Villanova

1489.46.text:
University wrote a compelling
piece in U.S. News and World

1493.03.text:
Report about her daughter's
first day in kindergarten.

1497.10.text:
The unsuspecting child
was bombarded with tests

1502.94.text:
She was tested on such
tasks as coloring within

1510.21.text:
her ability to
count and on and on.

1515.45.text:
After that first day the poor
child was a bundle of nerves.

1519.75.text:
Then the regular
school year commenced.

1522.22.text:
When Miss Connor picked
her daughter up after her

1524.32.text:
first real day of
kindergarten she didn't

1528.79.text:
She did not want to talk
about what she had done in

1531.13.text:
school Ms. Connor wrote
but she did say that she

1534.70.text: did not want to go back.

1536.87.text:
The point of the article
was that testing in our

1539.07.text:
public schools has gotten
bizarrely out of control.

1542.47.text:
Instead of being welcomed
into a warm and nurturing

1545.31.text:
environment this five year
old was confronted in her

1548.55.text:
mother's words by an
intimidating initiation

1552.12.text:
that turned the child
off rather than making her

1554.95.text:
feel eager to move
ahead and to learn.

1558.29.text:
It's time to take public
education back from the

1561.03.text:
data zealots and place it
in the hands of parents

1564.13.text:
and teachers with a better
understanding of what a

1567.00.text:
well rounded first class
education really means.

1571.27.text:
That's all for now.
